words.definition: An attic is a room just below a house’s roof.
words.example: There were two windows in their attic.

words.definition: A chunk is a thick, solid piece of something.
words.example: When they broke open the rock, they saw it was filled with chunks of gold.

words.definition: If something is civic, then it is related to a town or city, especially its government.
words.example: Most of the important civic buildings are located downtown.

words.definition: A descent is a movement downwards.
words.example: During the space shuttle’s descent, the astronauts felt a lot of pressure.

words.definition: A din is a loud, unpleasant, and extended noise.
words.example: The din from the construction site made it hard to sleep.

words.definition: To dissatisfy someone means to fail to please them.
words.example: The poor service at the restaurant dissatisfied the customers.

words.definition: A fuss is excited or anxious behavior about something unimportant.
words.example: She made a big fuss when she couldn't find her keys.

words.definition: A gourmet is a person who enjoys and knows a lot about food and drink.
words.example: The gourmet chef prepared a delicious meal.

words.definition: Hence means from this time or for this reason.
words.example: The road was closed; hence, we had to take a different route.

words.definition: If something is intrinsic, it is a natural part of something and cannot be separated from it.
words.example: Diamonds have an intrinsic beauty.

words.definition: A kettle is a container with a lid, handle, and spout used for boiling water.
words.example: The kettle began to whistle when the water boiled.

words.definition: A ministry is a government department.
words.example: The Ministry of Education is responsible for schools.

words.definition: An ordeal is a very difficult or painful experience.
words.example: Being lost in the desert was a terrible ordeal.

words.definition: If someone is outspoken, they say what they think even if it offends others.
words.example: He is an outspoken critic of the government.

words.definition: To overwork means to work too much or too hard.
words.example: She felt exhausted because she had been overworking.

words.definition: If something is particular, it is related to one person or thing.
words.example: She has a particular interest in ancient history.

words.definition: If something is pungent, it has a strong, sharp smell or taste.
words.example: The smell of the onions was very pungent.

words.definition: To snore means to breathe loudly through the nose and mouth while sleeping.
words.example: He snores so loudly that he wakes himself up.

words.definition: If you do something soundly, you do it completely or deeply.
words.example: The baby was sleeping soundly in the crib.

words.definition: A superintendent is a person who is in charge of a place or organization.
words.example: The school superintendent visited the classroom.
